title.narrative: Improved school attendance through effective menstrual hygiene management

description.narrative: Addressing girls' absenteeism in Zambia through distribution of reusable sanitary pads. Training of girls, boys and community stakeholders on Menstrual Hygiene Management (MHM) to break down societal taboos.

Increasing female school attendance in seven communities in Zambia. Output 1: increase knowledge of menstruation and good MHM amongst teachers, PTA members, peer educators, alangizi (female elders responsible for traditional teaching around mensuration) and community groups, staff, volunteers. Output 2: improved knowledge amongst girls and boys about menstruation and MHM. Output 3: development of good MHM practices amongst girls/youths.

Teachers, PTA members, peer educators, alangizi (female elders responsible for traditional teaching around mensuration) and community groups, staff, volunteers. Girls and boys. Households of menstruating girls.

recipient-country.narrative: Working in Lusaka Province and Northern Province.

description.narrative: Monitoring and evaluation in Zambia, baseline surveys.
Staff costs for project management and implementation.

Conducting MHM training sessions, providing menstrual and MHM education to boys and girls, providing girls/youths with access to modern methods of MHM, providing menstruating female members of targeted households access to modern methods of MHM, improved hygiene knowledge amongst girls/youth through sanitary pad WASH demonstrations, and ensure girls at one community school access to private space latrines with WASH facilities.
